intro: Teucrium pyrenaicum subsp. pyrenaicum, commonly known as purple germander, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring aromatic, lance-shaped leaves with a grayish-green hue. The plant produces showy, two-lipped blue to purple flowers in whorled clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its medicinal properties have been historically valued for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
